channel.title: 13. Describing People and Places – Adjectives in Action! on Italiano con Geoff

item.title: Lesson 13.1: Describing People – From Tall to Talkative
item.description: In this lesson, you’ll learn how to describe people in Italian — with real adjectives, real grammar, and some real personality.

item.title: Exercise 13.1: Practice – Describing People with Style
item.description: Put your new adjectives to the test! Fill in the blanks, fix the grammar, and maybe laugh once or twice.

item.title: Lesson 13.2: Describing Places – From Tiny Towns to Loud Cities
item.description: Learn how to describe places in Italian — whether it’s a quiet village, a chaotic piazza, or the café with the best cornetto.

item.title: Exercise 13.2: Practice – Describing Places in Style
item.description: Learn to describe Italian towns, cafés, and cities like a pro – or at least like someone who knows the word for ‘quiet’.

item.title: Lesson 13.3: Putting It All Together – Conversations & Descriptions
item.description: Review what you’ve learned and see how Geoff and Viktor handle describing people and places – sometimes correctly!

item.title: Exercise 13.3: Review – Describing People and Places
item.description: Time to bring it all together! Review adjectives with a mix of fun tasks – and yes, there’s a surprise piazza involved.
